division.name: LUMBOSACRAL NERVES - FOOT AND LOWER LEG

element.name: femoral nerve, leg
element.origin: lumbar PLEXUS (L2-L4); descending behind the inguinal ligament to the femoral triangle
element.distribution: skin of thigh and leg, muscles of front of thigh, and hip and knee joints

element.name: saphenous nerve
element.origin: termination of femoral nerve, descending first with femoral vessels and then on medial side of leg and foot, L3/L4
element.branches: infrapatellar and medial crural cutaneous branches
element.distribution: knee joint, subsartorial and patellar plexuses, skin on medial side of leg and foot

element.name: saphenous nerve, infrapatellar and sartorial branches
saphenous nerve, medial crural cutaneous branches
sciatic nerve
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne85.htm SCIATIC NERVE]; ischiadic nerve (largest nerve of body)
element.origin: lumbosacral plexus L4/L5, S1-S3; it leaves the pelvis through the greater sciatic foramen
element.branches: divides into the tibial and common fibular nerves, usually in lower third of thigh
element.modality: general sensory, flexor motor, extensor motor

element.name: common peroneal nerve
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/Ne54.htm COMMON PERONEAL NERVE]; popliteal nerve; common fibular nerve
element.origin: L4/L5, S1/S2, sciatic nerve in lower part of thigh
element.distribution: supplies short head of biceps femoris muscle (while still incorporated in sciatic nerve), gives off lateral sural cutaneous nerve and fibular communicating branch as it descends in popliteal fossa, supplies knee and superior tibiofibular joints and tibialis anterior muscle, and divides into superficial and deep fibular nerves
element.modality: general sensory, flexor motor, extensor motor

element.name: common peroneal nerve, articular branches
element.distribution: articular branches to the knee joint

element.name: fibular nerve, deep
element.origin: terminal branch of common fibular nerve
element.distribution: winds around the neck of the fibula and descends on the interosseous membrane to the front of the ankle; gives off muscular branches to anterior tibial, extensor of great toe, long extensor of toes, and third fibular muscles, and a twig to ankle joint; a lateral terminal division supplies the short extensor muscle of toes and tarsal joints; medial terminal division, or digital branch, divides into dorsal digital nerves for skin and joints of adjacent sides of first and second toes; Peroneous tertius, Extensor digitorum longus, Tibialis anterior, Extensor hallucis longus, Extensor digitorum brevis, Extensor hallucis brevis
element.action: Dorsiflexion and eversion of foot; Extension of four lateral toes; dorsiflexion and eversion of foot; Inversion and dorsiflexion of foot; Extension of great toe, dorsiflexion and inversion of foot; Extension of 2nd - 4th toes; Extension of big toe

element.name: fibular nerve, superficial
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/Ne94.htm SUPERFICIAL FIBULAR NERVE], superficial peroneal nerve, musculocutaneous nerve of foot
element.branches: medial - medial dorsal cutaneous nerve, lasteral - intermediate dorsal cutaneous nerve
element.origin: terminal branch of common fibular nerve
element.distribution: descends in front of the fibula, supplies long and short fibular muscles and, in the lower part of the leg, divides into the muscular branches, medial and intermediate dorsal cutaneous nerves; peroneous brevis, peroneous longus
element.action: Eversion and weak plantar flexion of foot

element.name: cutaneous nerve of foot, medial dorsal
element.distribution: nerves supplying 3-5 toes, skin and joints of medial side of foot and 1 toe, and adjacent sides of 2/3 toes; nerves supplying 1/2 toes, skin and joints of adjacent sides of 1/2 toes

element.name: cutaneous nerve of foot, intermediate dorsal
element.distribution: skin of front of lower third of leg and dorsum of foot, and skin and joints of adjacent sides of 3/4 toes, and of 4/5 toes

element.name: digital nerves of foot, dorsal
element.origin: superficial peroneal (medial and lateral) and deep peroneal nerve; intermediate dorsal cutaneous nerve
element.distribution: skin and joints of adjacent sides of 3/4 toes, and of 4/5 toes

element.name: cutaneous nerve of calf, lateral
element.distribution: skin of lateral side of back of leg, rarely may continue as the sural nerve

element.name: sural communicating nerve
element.distribution: cutaneous branches, sural nerve

element.name: tibial nerve
element.origin: sciatic nerve in lower part of thigh, L4/L5, S1-S3
element.branches: interosseous nerve of leg, medial cutaneous nerve of calf, sural nerve, and medial and lateral plantar nerves, and muscular and medial calcaneal branches
element.distribution: while still incorporated in the sciatic nerve, it supplies the semimembranous and semitendinous muscles, long head of biceps, and great adductor muscle; it supplies the knee joint as it descends in the popliteal fossa and, continuing into the leg, supplies the muscles and skin of the calf and sole of the foot, and the toes

element.name: cutaneous nerve of calf, medial
element.distribution: skin on back of leg, and skin and joints on lateral side of heel and foot

element.name: interosseous nerve of leg
element.distribution: interosseous membrane and tibiofibular syndesmosis

element.name: tibial nerve, muscular branches
element.action: Plantar flexion of foot; flexion of leg of free limb

element.name: sural nerve
element.origin: tibial nerve, L5, S1/S2; union of 3 nerves: medial and lateral sural cutaneus nerves, peroneal communicating branch
element.branches: cutaneous branches, vascular branches, medial calcaneal branches
element.distribution: cutaneous branch, back of leg, supplies skin of lateral 1/3 and posterior 2/3 of leg, skin on lateral aspect of foot up to little toe

element.name: sural nerve, calcaneal branches, medial
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/Ne209.htm MEDIAL CALCANEAL BRANCHES OF SURAL NERVE]; medial sural cutaneous nerve
element.distribution: cutaneous branch

element.name: cutaneous nerve of foot, lateral dorsal
element.distribution: skin and joints of lateral side of foot and 5 toe

element.name: plantar nerve, medial
element.branches: cutaneous, proper digital nerve to 1st toe, common digital nerve to 1st-2nd/2nd-3rd/3rd-4th, muscular branches to first lumbrical/abductor hallucis/flexor hallucis brevis/flexor digitorum

element.name: plantar nerve, medial, common digital branches
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/Ne89.htm COMMON DIGITAL BRANCHES OF MEDIAL PLANTAR NERVE]
element.branches: cutaneous branch to 1 toe, muscular branches to short flexor muscles of toes, flexor digitorum brevis
element.distribution: 1-4 toes

element.name: plantar nerve, medial, proper digital branches
element.distribution: 1-4 toes

element.name: plantar nerve, medial, branches to LAFF muscles
element.distribution: muscular branches to first lumbrical/abductor hallucis/flexor hallucis brevis/flexor digitorum
element.action: flexion of metatarsophalangeal joints, proximal phalanx of big toe, middle phalanges of lateral four toes

element.name: plantar nerve, lateral
element.origin: smaller of terminal branches of tibial nerve
element.distribution: lying between first and second layers of muscles of sole, it supplies the quadratus of sole, abductor of little toe, short flexor of little toe, adductor of great toe, interosseous, and second, third, and fourth lumbrical muscles, and gives off cutaneous and articular twigs to lateral side of sole and fourth and fifth toes

element.name: plantar nerve, lateral, superficial branch
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/Ne92.htm SUPERFICIAL BRANCH OF LATERAL PLANTAR NERVE]

element.name: plantar nerve, lateral, digital branches branch
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/Ne212.htm DIGITAL BRANCHES OF LATERAL PLANTAR NERVE]
element.distribution: lateral side of 4th/5th toe, interdigital cleft for 4th and 5th; flexor digiti minimi brevis, Abductor digiti minimi, Dorsal interossei, Plantar interossei
element.action: Flexion of proximal phalanx of little toe; Flexion and abduction of little toe, Abduction of toes, Adduction ot toes

element.name: digital nerves of lateral plantar nerve, common plantar
element.origin: superficial branch of lateral plantar nerve
element.branches: the medial nerve gives rise to two proper plantar digital nerves
element.distribution: the lateral one to the short flexor muscle of little toe and to skin and joints of lateral side of sole and little toe; the medial one to adjacent sides of fourth and fifth toes

element.name: digital nerves of lateral plantar nerve, proper plantar
element.distribution: short flexor muscle of little toe, skin and joints of lateral side of sole and little toe, and adjacent sides of fourth and fifth toes

element.name: plantar nerve, lateral, deep branch
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/Ne93.htm DEEP BRANCH OF LATERAL PLANTAR NERVE]
element.origin: lateral plantar nerve, like ulnar nerve in palm
element.distribution: deep surface of flexor tendons and adductor hallucis, muscular branches to all intrinsic and short muscles of sole excepting LAFF muscle; Quadratus plantae, Abductor hallucis, Adductor hallucis
element.action: Aids in flexion of lateral four toes by modifying pull by flexor digitorum longus tendon; Flexion of big toe at metatarsophalangeal joint; Adduction and flexion of big toe
